poem:
**Barn Owls in the Rafters**

A barn, open-fronted,  
concrete floor adorned  
with night's secret missives,  
pellets cast in shadow—  
speaks the silent news  
of owls, unseen,  
until a sneeze, abrupt,  
feathers the light with flight—  
a memory flushed,  
wings against the  
lavender dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Country Diary: Flushing out barn owls with an explosive sneeze | Derek Niemann Memories of our favourite open-fronted barn in Bedfordshire are forever tarnished by our final visit. Before that, we always made a point of pausing in the doorway and checking no one was home before entering. On its concrete floor, there was a regular smattering of pellets – solid evidence that owls had been roosting in the rafters, though I never saw one". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
